bibl.title: Late Antique Inscriptions from the First Cataract Area Discovered and Rediscovered.
bibl.note: 1-4: Greek inscriptions from the East Church of Philae (from the diary of Ludwig BORCHARDT, 1895-1896). Names of visitors, ca. end of VIth century. - 5-8: Greek inscriptions from a Late Antique quay wall on Elephantine (excavations of the Swiss Institute, 2000-2002). The name of an actuarius, an indiction year, an acclamation and a commemoration of the Inundation of the Nile, ca. second half of the VIth century).
bibl.seg: DIJKSTRA Jitse H.F., Late Antique Inscriptions from the First Cataract Area Discovered and Rediscovered.

1-4: Greek inscriptions from the East Church of Philae (from the diary of Ludwig BORCHARDT, 1895-1896). Names of visitors, ca. end of VIth century. - 5-8: Greek inscriptions from a Late Antique quay wall on Elephantine (excavations of the Swiss Institute, 2000-2002). The name of an actuarius, an indiction year, an acclamation and a commemoration of the Inundation of the Nile, ca. second half of the VIth century).
